name: Prevent Child Abuse Kentucky
description: Prevent Child Abuse Kentucky works to prevent child abuse and neglect in the state through advocacy, awareness, education, and training. They provide a Parent Helpline (800-432-9251) for parents seeking support and guidance. Services include child abuse prevention education, advocacy for child protection policies, training programs, and community awareness initiatives. Their mission is to create a safe and nurturing environment for Kentucky's children by building a better Kentucky through shaping future leaders and their families.
source: Verified from official PCAK website and multiple government sources
notes: Parent Helpline available for immediate support. Organization is the Kentucky chapter of Prevent Child Abuse America. They provide legislative advocacy and work with partners across the state to prevent child abuse and neglect.
